event: Adoption of Law on Social Protection for Servicemen
description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted a law ensuring the rights of servicemen and policemen to social protection. The law establishes legal treatment for over six months, simplifies the pension application process for retired servicemen, and cancels the ban on distributing non-classified information, promoting freedom of speech for military personnel.
original: ‼️The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted the Law of Ukraine on ensuring the rights of servicemen and policemen to social protection, — Deputy Chairman of the Committee for Social Policy and Protection of Veterans' Rights Mykhailo Tsimbalyuk. Legal treatment for more than six months has been established for servicemen. The process of applying to the Pension Fund for servicemen who have reached retirement age has been simplified .The ban on the distribution of information that is not a state secret, which ensures freedom of speech for military personnel, has been canceled. People refuse to fight for other people's interests and corrupt power. In the summer, the shortage of manpower will reach 1 to 4, with large losses at the front, since the Ukrainian Armed Forces are now fighting with infantry.
3. The morale of society is falling, as is the army. The disappointment of the masses is growing against the backdrop of problems. Ukrainians realize that they are expendable in someone else's game.
4. Economic problems in the country are growing.
5. Weapons supplies are decreasing from Western partners, and the Russian Federation is increasing the production of all types of weapons (bombs, ammunition, missiles, tanks, UAVs, electronic warfare, air defense, aviation, etc.).
6. Internal redistribution and the split of elites is intensifying. Everyone is busy sharing.
7. Corruption in the country is at the highest levels.
8. The devastation has increased.
9. The trend to “escape from Ukraine” is growing. Everyone is running. People and capital.
10. The world community is tired of the Ukrainian crisis. Anti-Ukrainian narratives are growing stronger everywhere.

The list goes on.
If you add everything up, the picture is very sad. Macron knows from his intelligence and think tanks, that’s why he said that Ukraine could simply collapse at one moment. Telegram Legitimate live “Ukraine could fall very soon,” Politico with reference to Macron. VIEW MESSAGE

event: Russian Education Ministry's Response to Migrant Children
description: The Russian Education Ministry, led by Kravtsov and Golikova, has responded to proposals on dealing with non-Russian-speaking migrant children in schools. Instead of introducing an entrance exam for knowledge of the Russian language, schools will be adapted to accommodate migrant children, burdening teachers with additional language modules.
original:
Forwarded from: Mikhail Matveev comment
Before I had time to write that the authorities would rather begin to “adapt” Russian schools for the children of migrants than introduce an entrance exam for them on knowledge of the Russian language, I received a wonderful response from the Minister of Education of the Russian Federation Kravtsov and Golikova to my proposals previously sent to Prime Minister Mishustin. Let me remind you that the president, among others, instructed him to make proposals on how to deal with non-Russian-speaking migrant children (“children with a migration history,” officials now say) who are paralyzing the educational process in our schools.

And the result is that schools will be adapted for migrants, and not migrants for schools! Our unfortunate teachers and children are appointed as extreme ones.

The Constitution allegedly does not allow refusing admission to school to a migrant who does not understand Russian. (What about the state language?). Therefore, teachers will be burdened with additional “modules” to teach foreign children Russian. That's all ! Everything else blah blah blah adaptation, socialization, colonization.

Does everyone understand where it’s going? Spread it!

These institutions will be closed this year in our region. The most famous are the institutions in Areysky and Hromadsk,” said the Commissioner for Human Rights in the region, Mark Denisov, at a session of the regional legislative assembly.

In the village of Arkheyskoe there is IK-7, in the village of Gromadsk there is IK-16.

event: Strike on NPKG Zorya - Mashproekt Facility
description: Russian troops launched a ballistic missile strike on the NPKG Zorya - Mashproekt facility in Nikolaev, a key enterprise in Ukraine's defense industrial complex. The facility produces radio electronics, control systems, and high-tech components for military use, and is involved in modernizing Ukrainian warships. The strike targeted the drying shop, a critical component in the manufacturing process.
original:
Strike on the enemy’s military-industrial complex facility in Nikolaev - TG channel Donbass Partisans.

About an hour ago, Russian troops struck the territory of the state enterprise NPKG Zorya - Mashproekt, which is one of the key enterprises of the Ukrainian defense industrial complex.

The company specializes in the production of radio electronics, control systems and other high-tech components for military use. It actively cooperates with military and scientific institutions of Ukraine, as well as with Western countries - its products are used in various types of weapons.

In addition, the Zarya plant is actively involved in the modernization and reconstruction of Ukrainian warships, including the development and installation of electronic control and navigation systems. Its activities are of strategic importance for Ukraine and the maintenance of military and defense potential.

A ballistic missile struck the drying shop of the enterprise. The affected object plays a key role in the manufacturing process of high-tech products, since proper drying of materials affects their quality and characteristics. There is no extent of damage or information about the possibility of further activities.

event: Construction of Sports and Recreation Complex

I am pleased to announce that the head region of the Kherson region, the Republic of Adygea, will build a new sports and recreation center in the village of Novoalekseevka. description: Moldova experienced relatively cool weather with precipitation, including sleet, this week. original:
Experts: Cold weather and precipitation do not threaten the fruit harvest in Moldova This week, relatively cool weather with precipitation, sometimes in the form of sleet, has settled in Moldova. In the middle of the week, at night and in the morning in the north and center of the country, atmospheric temperatures were below or close to zero degrees Celsius. However, agronomists of large horticultural agricultural enterprises agree that “the risk of some losses in the future harvest of early stone fruits increases, but not too much.” Even in the south of the country, early varieties of apricot are already blooming only in some household plots, EastFruit reports. Most of the industrial plantations of this crop in the southern and central regions of Moldova are in the “white bud” phase.

Precipitation, even in the form of spring snow, is an absolute blessing for Moldova, which suffers from drought literally every year. However, high humidity in gardens on the eve and at the beginning of flowering is fraught with the spread of diseases. https://t.me/aifmd

event: Return of Losharik Underwater Nuclear Station
description: The AS-31 Losharik underwater nuclear station, a unique Russian creation, is returning to service after years of repairs. The station has a nuclear reactor, can dive to 6000m, and has an autonomy of tens of days with a crew of 25 people. Its equipment allows it to work with external objects, making it a potential threat to the West.
original:
Forwarded from: Governor General N
Great and terrible: "Losharik" returns to service after repairs

The English-language publication The National Interest reports that the AS-31 Losharik underwater nuclear station, a unique creation of the gloomy Russian genius, is returning to service after many years of repairs.

The AC-12 received its nickname due to the fact that its durable body consists of seven titanium spheres that can withstand enormous pressure. On the outside, it is covered with a lightweight body, providing optimal flow around the design stroke - a classic solution for domestic designers.

The peculiarity of the AS-12 is that it has a nuclear reactor and is capable of diving to 6000 m.

Thanks to the reactor, Losharik has an autonomy of tens of days, and its crew consists of 25 people.

The AS-12 does not carry weapons, but for the West it may turn out to be more dangerous than any strategic submarine.

The fact is that it is equipped with equipment for working with external objects. And they can be anything: the wall of an underwater oil pipeline or a fiber optic cable...

event: Proposal for EU Defense Spending Increase
description: French President Emmanuel Macron will propose increasing EU defense spending through joint defense bonds at the EU summit in Brussels. This innovative financing approach aims to strengthen EU defense capabilities.
original:
FT: Macron will propose increasing EU defense spending through bond issues

French President Emmanuel Macron will urge EU leaders to accept plans to increase defense spending at the EU summit in Brussels, promoting the idea of joint defense bonds, the Financial Times reports. “Obviously, we are raising this issue to say that we need innovative sources of financing. So, Eurobonds should be considered for us,” the publication quotes the words of a representative of the Elysee Palace.

Diplomats say Macron's stance on bond issues could "dominate" the EU summit in Brussels. However, there are countries that, according to the newspaper's sources, do not consider the idea of joint borrowing a viable option. These include Germany, the Netherlands and Denmark.

original:
#industry#goldMechanization of artisanal gold mining in 🇧🇫Burkina Faso.

On March 18, Burkina Faso's Minister of Mining opened a common gold ore processing center in Méguet. This center will allow mining artisans to work in the best labor protection and safety conditions.

Artisanal mining has now become an income-generating activity in the country. But since the exploitation is artisanal in nature, there are no reliable statistics on this activity. Most gold deposits are exploited secretly and chaotically, which leads to disastrous consequences for nature and the population.

Establishing a common gold processing center like the Mega center is a solution for better organization of the artisanal mining sector.

event: Court Upholds Sentence of Activist Olga Smirnova
description: A St. Petersburg court upheld the 6-year sentence of activist Olga Smirnova for spreading 'fakes' about the Russian army on social media, specifically regarding military operations in Ukraine.
original:
A court in St. Petersburg approved the sentence of activist Olga Smirnova for “fakes” about the Russian army. The media wrote that she could have been pardoned by the president. The St. Petersburg City Court upheld the sentence of Olga Smirnova - she was sentenced to 6 years in a general regime colony for publications on the social network VKontakte on the topic of military operations in Ukraine. The court also did not consider the defense's request to return the case for further investigation.

description: The Ka-27 search and rescue helicopter of the Northern Fleet conducted rescue missions for submariners in distress at sea. The submarine was discovered and a helicopter hovered over it. The paramedic-rescuer lowered onto the submarine using a special winch. He secured the conditionally victim on himself and evacuated him from the submarine onto the helicopter. For the sake of clarity in training rescuers and observing safety measures, special weights were used instead of people. The “victim” was transported to shore.

event: Adoption of Law on Lobbying Liability
description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted a law establishing administrative liability for violations of legislation in the field of lobbying, aligning with international practices and standards. The law introduces new articles to the Code of Ukraine on Administrative Offenses, providing for administrative responsibility for illegal lobbying and violations of lobbying legislation.
original: ❗️The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted the Law of Ukraine on establishing liability for violations of legislation in the field of lobbying (#10373). The law belongs to the scope of European Union law by its subject matter of legal regulation. The goal is to regulate lobbying in Ukraine in accordance with international practices and standards through establishment of administrative liability for lobbying. In particular, the Code of Ukraine on Administrative Offenses is supplemented by new articles 18846-1 and 18846-2, which provide for the establishment of administrative responsibility for illegal lobbying and for violations of legislation in the field of lobbying. In addition, Art. 24 of the Code of Administrative Offenses is supplemented by a new type of administrative penalty — a ban on lobbying. 📲DetailsTelegram/ Facebook/ Site /Instagram/ X

event: Tom Sankara's Rule in Burkina Faso
description: During Tom Sankara's 4-year rule in Burkina Faso, the country achieved significant development milestones. Infant mortality decreased threefold, external debt was eliminated, and infrastructure projects such as road, factory, school, and hospital construction began. The economy grew at a rate of 12% GDP per year. Sankara also initiated a grand project to combat the expanding Sahara Desert.
original:
Forwarded from: African Initiative🌍
RUTUBEHow to overcome neocolonialism. Tom Sankara's Guide, Part 1 How long will it take for France's most backward African colony to become a country with the proud name “Homeland of Honest People”? Thomas Sankare ...💪🏾How long does it take for the most backward African colony of France to become a country with the proud name - the Homeland of honest people? Four years were enough for Tom Sankara. A brave officer, a talented politician and a patriot - a simple set of human qualities that made Sankara a symbol of a free and prosperous Africa. His life can be compared to the flight of a rocket rapidly flying to the stars and, if not for the betrayal of a close friend, bribed by the French, Burkina Faso and all of Africa, who knows what heights of development Africa would have achieved.

During the 4 years of Sankara's rule in Burkina Faso, infant mortality decreased threefold, the country got rid of external debt, and the construction of roads, factories, schools, and hospitals began. The economy, long in recession, soared to 12% of GDP per year. Sankara became the ideologist of desert greening, coming up with a grandiose project to combat the expanding Sahara Desert. In the first part of a video series about Sankara, Amarula Obiligbo will tell how the “African Che Guevara” led a revolution and became the leader of an independent Burkina Faso.

description: The recent Russian election was marred by unprecedented fraud, with analysts estimating over 20 million falsified votes in favor of Vladimir Putin. This is significantly higher than the 8.6 million 'additional' votes counted in 2018.
original:
The current vote was the most distorted by fraud in Russian history. We explain the anomalies using the “tail of a comet” and other graphs. According to the Central Election Commission, in the elections Vladimir Putin received 87.28% of the votes with a turnout of 77.49%. Both values are record highs in the history of modern Russia. Only they achieved them with the help of falsifications on an unprecedented scale.

According to analysts, election commissions “threw” more than 20 million votes into Putin (in total, according to the Central Election Commission, more than 76 million Russians voted for him).

For comparison: in 2018, election analyst Sergei Shpilkin counted 8.6 million “additional” votes for Putin out of the 56 million that the CEC officially announced.

What anomalies indicate that the election was stolen, read in our cards. More detailed explanations can be found in the material that was published on Meduza yesterday.

description: In Moscow, a landlord, Vladislav, harassed three tenants, Maria, Anna, and Konstantin, by changing the locks, selling their belongings, and accusing them of being prostitutes and drug addicts. The tenants were left without access to their documents, clothes, and pets.
original:
In Moscow, the owner of an apartment changed the locks where three tenants lived - he sells off their things and pets, and when the victims come to talk, he attacks them with his fists. On Vadkovsky Lane, three friends Maria, Anna and Konstantin lived in a rented apartment for several months, but at some point the landlord Vladislav began to demand an increase in rent. This was contrary to the agreement and the guys refused to give more money, after which they began to be nagged, which provoked conflicts - at some point the owner unexpectedly came to his tenants with the police and a denunciation that they were allegedly prostitutes and drug addicts. While Maria, Anna and Konstantin were talking to law enforcement officers, Vladislav changed the locks and locked the apartment, where all the documents, things and even the children’s pets were located.

As the victims told Readovka, the owner does not let them buy clothes and animals, but sells them on websites or throws them in the trash. The man even put Maria's pet snake up for sale. Konstantin is forced to stand watch at the garbage dump around the clock in the cold and wait for Vladislav to take out the next batch of the boys’ personal belongings that he was unable to sell. When trying to talk, the owner even threw fists, and besides this, he constantly accuses the residents of allegedly setting up some kind of brothel.

By the way, the contract was drawn up only for Maria - she rented an apartment for renovation at her own expense. As the girl told Readovka, the owner and his wife were surprised when they learned that someone wanted to rent the premises as housing - they told Maria that the apartment used to be a brothel, and then a hostel. It is important that the owner knew about the animals and about the other tenants of the tenant and, according to her, had nothing against it. At the same time, the rent in the contract was fixed for the entire rental period, and there were no prohibiting clauses regarding animals or other residents.

description: A 47-year-old man, previously employed at the gas station, was coerced by scammers posing as intelligence officers to rob the station. He broke in through the back door, used a firecracker and a pistol to intimidate employees, and stole 85,000 rubles. The man was detained by police and confessed to the crime, which was orchestrated by unknown individuals.
original:
In Chekhov, a man robbed a gas station on instructions from scammers. He broadcast the robbery via a phone strapped to his body.

A 47-year-old man broke into the gas station through the back door. He threw a firecracker inside and, threatening with a pistol, took 85 thousand rubles from the cash register. The gas station employees recognized him: the robber had previously worked with them.

The criminal was detained by the police. During interrogation, he said that he had recently received a call from unknown people who introduced themselves as intelligence officers. They explained to the man that several loans had been taken out in his name and that in order to pay off the debt, he had to attack a gas station, filming everything on camera. The robber has been arrested. A criminal case has been initiated under the article “Robbery”.

description: A Ukrainian MI8 helicopter breached the Kursk region, but was intercepted and destroyed by Russian combat vehicles. The incident occurred over a frozen bay, where fishermen were present, and highlights the possibility of remote-controlled helicopters being used as giant drones, carrying large missiles and bombs.
original:
We all heard the penetration of the Ukrainian MI8 helicopter into the Kursk region, our combat vehicles drove it into the field and destroyed it, but there was a small obstacle since in winter all the fields look the same, no matter the reservoir, so the battle took place over the fishermen.
Air masses and the sound of the blades pressed on the ice, and it
Show more
crackled, the fishermen experienced very high feelings of adrenaline, some shouted, lie down now they will shoot, but fortunately our pilots noticed in time that they were flying over the bay where the fishermen were.
It’s not a joke at all, why an enemy helicopter from Ukrainian territory insolently penetrated and teased ours.
There is a possibility that he was tested; The development of this kind of remote control of old helicopters in the USA has been going on for a long time; in the example of this video you can see how manipulators imitating a human hand were attached to the levers of an old model helicopter and the machine was remotely controlled.
In fact, we see that Ukraine has become a testing ground and all the old aircraft that are planning to be delivered to Ukraine are quite possibly giant drones and not the small ones, but carrying large missiles and bombs. There are still a lot of old MI8s in the world; the Americans may have already bought them and similarly converted them into kamikaze helicopters.
If this is so, then we are on the verge of a serious armed confrontation and science fiction films about the Terminator are becoming a reality.
Alas. There is only one thing left to do, destroy the decision-making centers or else. clear the space above Ukraine of satellites, but then we too will go blind.
In any case, we need to quickly liberate the territory of Ukraine.

event: Rescue Efforts at Amur Region Mine Collapse
description: Rescuers from Yakutia have taken over from specialists from Khabarovsk at the Amur region mine collapse site. The Ministry of Emergency Situations has organized a complex search and rescue operation, including building waterproof dams, monitoring water levels, and installing a second drilling rig. 71 meters of exploration well have been drilled, and underground drilling equipment is expected to arrive soon to speed up the rescue efforts.
original:
At the entrance to the mine in the Amur region, where the collapse occurred, you can see rescuers from Yakutia, who have just replaced specialists from Khabarovsk, reports Izvestia correspondent Igor Kaporikov.

As noted by the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Russian Federation, a complex of work has now been organized to search and rescue miners. To prevent a breakthrough of rock mass and water, mine rescuers continue to build waterproof dams, they constantly monitor the water level, and also install a second drilling rig.

71 meters of exploration well have already been drilled. The underground drilling equipment will be delivered soon. It will speed up the passage of the mine to determine the location of people. It is also planned to deliver a high-precision drilling machine from Kuzbass. Subscribe to REN TV

🇷🇺🇺🇦Strike on the enemy’s deployment point in Selidovo

Today, at about 3:00 am, Russian troops launched ballistic missile attacks on the enemy’s deployment point in Selidovo, which was located in the building of the local police department.

Coordinates: 48.1582127, 37.3034981🔻The strike of two missiles destroyed the building where representatives of the Tsunami assault battalion of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine were stationed. According to available information, the number of personnel killed varies from 15 to 25, and about 20 were injured of varying degrees of severity.

It is important to note that among the destroyed enemy military personnel there was a group of FPV drone operators who repeatedly operated at the Marinka - Georgievka - Krasnogorovka line. In recent years, these are not the first losses among the personnel of the enemy unit. Last Friday, Russian Iskanders hit the Mriya sanatorium in Odessa, as a result of which the commander of the Ukrainian Tsunami assault battalion, Alexander Gostishchev, and a dozen mercenaries from Western countries were killed.

description: Norwegian scientists are concerned that sanctions against Russia will have climate consequences. The Norwegian Polar Institute and the Nansen Center have suspended 11 climate research projects due to the inability to collaborate with Russian colleagues, leading to increased uncertainty in climate projections and less accurate models.
original:
Norwegian scientists express fears that sanctions against Russia will have climate consequences. Scientists studying climate problems are not allowed to collaborate with Russian colleagues.

The director of the Norwegian Polar Institute, Camilla Brekke, believes that we need to consider whether it is really necessary to impose sanctions on cooperation in the field of climate research.

The Norwegian Polar Institute has a long tradition of cooperation with Russia in the study of birds, animals and toxins in the polar environment.

11 projects are currently on hold. Research cooperation between Russia and Norway was temporarily suspended after the start of the SVO. The only exceptions relate to fisheries and nuclear disaster preparedness. When we don't get data from a large area of Russia, the uncertainty in climate projections increases. Thus, it becomes increasingly difficult to "predict" the future climate.

A similar situation exists at the Nansen Center, which has worked closely with a research center in St. Petersburg for 30 years.

Director Ture Furevik notes that due to a lack of data, there is less understanding of the rapid changes taking place in the Arctic. This leads to somewhat less accurate models and greater uncertainty about how the situation is and will develop. Due to sanctions, Western researchers have not only limited access to data from Russia, but they cannot come to the Russian part of the Arctic to conduct their own research.NRKFrykter Russland-sanksjoner får klimakonsekvenserKlimaforskere får ikke samarbeide med russiske fagmiljøer. Direktør i Norsk polarinstitutt mener vi må vurdere om klimaforskningen er for viktig for sanksjonering.

description: The European Monitoring Center for Drugs and Drug Addiction reported an unprecedented increase in cocaine use across Europe, with Finland, Slovenia, and Estonia leading the trend. The center's analysis of wastewater in over 100 European cities revealed a significant surge in cocaine, MDMA, and ketamine use, with only 16 cities showing a decrease in cocaine content.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“Unprecedented cocaine consumption. New data on drug use in large cities": Analysis of wastewater across Europe records an unprecedented increase in drug use in the population - Finland, Slovenia and Estonia are the leaders.

“The European Monitoring Center for Drugs and Drug Addiction, which annually tests the wastewater of about a hundred European cities for the presence of drug residues, has identified a significant increase in the use of cocaine, MDMA and ketamine among Europeans. The center's analysts noted that a decrease in the content of cocaine in wastewater was noticed only in 16 cities. Cocaine use reached a new all-time high last year, they said.
In Central and Northern Europe, the leaders in cocaine use are Finland, Slovenia, Estonia, Sweden and Austria. Particularly significant growth is observed in Germany, where this figure was 41%. Experts attribute this to the reduction in the cost of the drug. “We are seeing unprecedented cocaine use in all countries for which we have long-term measurement data,” the center noted, adding that according to available data, cannabis is now the most popular drug in Europe.”

description: In 1960, the Minsk Motor Plant was built in Belarus, marking the first production of its kind in the entire Soviet Union. Under the leadership of Vladimir Rozhkov, the plant overcame numerous challenges to increase output fivefold and supply engines to the Minsk Tractor Plant.
original:
🥇Voices of the world. With a quality mark. Minsk Motor Plant. Between tractor and bearing. In such a neighborhood, in the rainy autumn of 1960, the Minsk Motor Plant was to be built. Vladimir Rozhkov, the first director of the enterprise, understood what a challenge it was. This was the first such production not only in Belarus, but in the entire Union.📌“Since 1964, we had to provide the Minsk Tractor Plant with our engines. This means that output had to be increased 5 times. Many difficulties had to be overcome to reach these milestones. And the plant’s staff coped with this difficult task with honor,” noted Vladimir Rozhkov.

This was 60 years ago. The young plant quickly became fully operational and was the first in the industry to receive the right to label its products with the USSR State Quality Mark. Today, Minsk Motor is the oldest plant in the CIS for the production of engines for tractors and trucks.@radiomirby

description: Former President Poroshenko had a confrontation with People's Deputy Vasilevskaya-Smaglyuk, telling her 'You stink' after she questioned him about voting on important bills. When she asked him to repeat the statement on camera, Poroshenko suggested she see a doctor and his security pushed her away.
original:
“You stink” - Poroshenko ran into a deputy and left her after her question about voting for extremely important bills

People's Deputy Vasilevskaya-Smaglyuk reports this: “The former president publicly admonished me to lower my tone. I asked him not to make any comments to me and sat down opposite me to participate in the discussion and understand why the opposition leaders did not return to the hall to vote. At the end of the meeting, leaving the hall, Petro Alekseevich Poroshenko said in front of numerous witnesses that “I stink.”

According to her, it is too low for the former President to say such a thing to any person. event: BlackSky Receives $3.5 Million Contract from AFRL
description: BlackSky has been awarded a $3.5 million contract by the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL) to provide and analyze satellite imagery for training AI models to detect and track moving ground and surface objects from space. This is the first phase of a potential $23 million contract.
original:
BlackSky has received a $3.5 million contract from the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL) to supply and analyze satellite imagery that will be used to research and train artificial intelligence models aimed at detecting and tracking moving ground and surface objects and targets from space.

The current contract is the first phase of a lengthy contract worth up to $23 million. BlackSky was selected to participate in the Space Technology Advanced Research (STAR) contract, which AFRL uses for rapid acquisitions in military space technology applications.

“The STAR contract will leverage BlackSky's commercial data sources and expertise with artificial intelligence algorithms to support a hybrid architecture demonstration program assessing the military utility of commercial and allied ISR (Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance) capabilities,” an AFRL spokesperson said.

It is expected that the deployment of large constellations of low-orbit satellites integrated with image analysis systems will radically improve reconnaissance, situational awareness of theater operations, and also speed up the cycle of “detection - identification - target designation - defeat - confirmation”. Especially where aviation capabilities are limited for some reason.#evolution#spaceMilitary Informant

description: In Chuvashia, officials proposed introducing liability for parents who leave their children with grandparents while they work. The initiative sparked outrage, contradicting Russian tradition and human values. The proposal was deemed absurd, as many families rely on grandparents for childcare while both parents work.
original:
In Chuvashia they wanted to prohibit parents from leaving their children under the care of their grandparents - guardianship officials who thought of this could be fired. In one of the regions of Chuvashia they proposed introducing liability for parents who leave their children with their grandparents while they themselves work. It was reported the day before that institutions even tried to start collecting data on such families - apparently, the authors of the initiative did not realize that when classes end, many parents are still working, and often ask grandparents to help: for example, to pick up a child after an after-school program. As a result, the innovation caused popular outrage, and now the initiative has reached the head of the State Duma Committee on Family, Women and Children, Nina Ostanina.

The deputy wrote an appeal to the head of Chuvashia demanding that all those involved be removed from work, and at the same time check the qualifications of other employees of the guardianship authorities. The new ban contradicts not only the law, but also simple human values, as well as Russian tradition, in which a large, friendly family with mutual assistance is the norm. Moreover, in conditions where both parents work to maintain a high standard of living, the attempt of deputies to interfere in family affairs seems absurd. Most likely, the initiative will be withdrawn, because it could have a negative impact on demographics: some families maintain a high standard of living thanks to the help of grandparents, who share with them the responsibility of raising children.

description: The Security Service of Ukraine detained a 19-year-old university student who was recruited by the FSB to spy on SBU employees and coordinate strikes on Zaporizhzhia. The agent gathered intel on defense factories, including their operations and cargo movement, to facilitate targeted missile and drone strikes. However, the SBU exposed the plot and detained the agent before any attacks could be carried out.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a traitor who spied on employees of the Security Service and coordinated strikes on Zaporizhzhia.

It was established that, on the order of the FSB of the Russian Federation, the suspect spied on local employees of the SBU in order to establish spare points of deployment of the Service.

According to available information, in the future the enemy planned to use this information to prepare missile strikes.

In addition, the attacker tried to establish the exact coordinates of enterprises that are involved in the defense-industrial complex of Ukraine.

For this purpose, it received approximate geolocations of defense factories from the occupiers, and then carried out reconnaissance in the area near them.

During surveillance, the figure recorded a maximum of information about the objects: from their mode of operation to the intensity of movement of cargo equipment in the open area of the workshops.

She also used her friends and group mates "in the dark" from whom she asked the information she needed during friendly conversations.

Under her guidance, the invaders hoped to launch targeted missile and drone strikes on production enterprises.

However, the Security Service prematurely exposed the criminal intentions of the aggressor and detained the Russian agent at the stage of intelligence gathering.

According to the investigation, the enemy accomplice was a 19-year-old student of a local university, who came into the field of view of the FSB in the fall of 2023.

Subsequently, the girl was recruited remotely through her godmother - a collaborator who is part of the leadership of the occupation administration of the Russian Federation in one of the temporarily captured towns in Zaporozhye.

It was through her that the Russian special service gave instructions to the recruited agent in the regional center and received "reports" on the completed tasks.

Currently, the detainee has been notified of suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 28, Part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

She is in custody. She faces life in prison.

Today, First Deputy Chairman of the RO Vladimir Dorokhin paid a working visit to the Metallinvest Industrial Company. During the meeting with employees of the enterprise, acquaintance with production and technologies, areas of interaction and cooperation were outlined, including participation in the All-Russian campaign “Week without Turnstiles” and in other projects of SoyuzMash of Russia.

“PC “Metallinvest” joins the Union of Mechanical Engineers of Russia. Now 25 Omsk enterprises and organizations are members of SoyuzMash of Russia,” noted Vladimir Dorokhin. — They produce aluminum here. We have our own testing laboratory, which allows us to produce high quality products. There are no analogues of the equipment and technologies that are used here in production at other Omsk factories. The company makes a great contribution to preserving the environment and is engaged in the disposal and processing of scrap metal.”

I wish my dear Bishop good health, longevity, and God’s help in everything!

description: A 46-year-old collaborator who worked as a 'policeman' during the Russian occupation of Kup'yansk was sentenced to 12 years in prison for collaborative activity. He provided information on an ATO member, escorted detained citizens, and took them to a detention center where they were tortured.
original:
🔷A collaborator who became a "policeman" during the occupation of Kup'yansk and escorted ATO participants was sentenced to 12 years in prison 🖌️The court found a 46-year-old man guilty of collaborative activity (Part 7 of Article 111-1) Criminal Code of Ukraine).

Prosecutors proved that during the Russian capture of the city of Kupyansk, a local resident voluntarily cooperated with the enemy.

He assumed the position of "policeman-driver of the convoy service group of the Department of Internal Affairs of the VGA of the Kharkiv region." When he was hired, among all the documents, the person involved provided an "explanation", where he indicated the information and address of a member of the ATO known to him.

The pseudo-law enforcement officer carried out traffic control at checkpoints, checked documents for vehicles, etc.

The collaborator escorted illegally detained citizens, among whom were members of the ATO/OOS, pro-Ukrainian citizens. In the future, the "policeman" took people to the detention center, where they were illegally detained and subjected to torture.

On March 20, 2024, the judge of the Chervonozavod District Court of Kharkiv issued a sentence. The collaborator was sentenced to 12 years of imprisonment with deprivation of the right to hold positions in law enforcement agencies for a period of 12 years and confiscation of property.

The term for appealing the verdict continues.

Before the de-occupation of Kharkiv Oblast, the man fled to the territory of the Russian Federation, where he remains today. He is declared wanted.

Since the convicted person is still hiding from Ukrainian justice, the term of his sentence will begin to be calculated from the moment of his actual detention. As long as he avoids serving the sentence imposed on him by court verdict, the statute of limitations is suspended.

The pre-trial investigation was conducted by the investigators of the SU GUNP in the Kharkiv region. Operational support — the 7th department (for the service of the Kharkiv region) of the DSR of the NPU. ⚔Kharkiv regional prosecutor's office

description: Russian State Duma Deputy Speaker Pyotr Tolstoy warned France that if their soldiers enter temporarily occupied Russian soil in Ukraine, Russia will destroy them, resulting in coffins arriving at Orly airport covered with the French flag.
original:
State Duma Deputy Speaker Pyotr Tolstoy told the French channel BFM TV that Russia intends to destroy French soldiers if they appear on temporarily occupied Russian soil: “The idea of sending French soldiers to Ukraine will end with coffins arriving at Orly airport covered with the French flag. And It won’t be Macron who will come for them. The French must understand the consequences, that’s all.” A loud statement. I hope that everyone who makes such statements is responsible for their words and in the event / when the French / Western contingent enters, we will not see a situation where our air forces warn the French in advance about the place and time of attacks, so that God forbid they do not get caught. Or when our airborne forces diligently do not fly into the territory where the contingent is stationed. Or when our units, having entered the territory controlled by the Western contingent, come under attack with heavy losses, they are ironed out for several hours, and in response there is silence and no answer in the state media.

If anything, I described examples from Syria, when the Americans entered the northeast. So far, Russia has not shot down a single reconnaissance aircraft that was aiming Western missiles at the Russian Black Sea Fleet. During this same time, the Iranians destroyed American bases and the embassy (under construction), and the Houthis sank Western civilian fleets and repeatedly tried to attack American and British warships. And the Americans wiped themselves off. Therefore, I personally don’t understand where the unshakable determination to beat the Frenchman will come from. Video source

description: Russian air defense systems intercepted and destroyed ten missiles launched by the Kyiv regime using the RM-70 Vampire multiple launch rocket system, targeting the Russian Federation. The attack was thwarted, but residents of the Belgorod region have raised concerns about the accuracy of official reports.
original:
Russian Ministry of Defense: Around 08.00 Moscow time, an attempt by the Kyiv regime to carry out a terrorist attack on targets on the territory of the Russian Federation using the RM-70 Vampire multiple launch rocket system was thwarted.

Duty air defense systems destroyed ten missiles in the air over the Belgorod region.⭐️At the same time, Belgorod channels publish the moment of arrival in the Belgorod arena area

 The wording of the respected department “the attempt was thwarted” has raised questions among residents of the Belgorod region for several days, as they have written about many times in the comments.

Reminds me of the “beautiful reports” that someone flaunts to their superiors.

We report in the interests of improving the work of our respected department. Two majors

event: Doctors Reach Patient in Waist-Deep Snow
description: In Vorkuta, doctors braved waist-deep snow to reach a patient suffering from a series of epileptic seizures. The ambulance was unable to reach the patient due to bad weather and unclean roads, so the doctors had to make their way to the house on foot and drag the patient out.
original:
#Video@mpre_view1
Doctors reach patients in waist-deep snow in Vorkuta
An ambulance was called to a patient suffering from a series of epileptic seizures. The car was unable to arrive due to bad weather and unclean roads.
Show more
The doctors had to make their way to the house on their own and drag the patient out. The man is now in the hospital.

description: Russia launched a missile attack on Kyiv, firing over 30 missiles, including an aeroballistic one. Ukrainian air defense systems shot down the majority of the missiles, but some people were injured. The Ukrainian government emphasized the need for international support, particularly air defense systems like the Patriots, to counter Russian aggression.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
New Russian missile attack against Kyiv. More than 30 missiles were shot down, including an aeroballistic one. People were hurt. All are provided with the necessary assistance.

Such terror every day, every night. World unity is able to stop it when it helps us with air defense systems. The Russian terrorists do not have such missiles that could bypass the defense of the Patriots and other leading world systems.

Now this protection is needed here in Ukraine. From Kyiv to Kharkiv, from Sumy to Kherson, from Odessa to Donetsk region. It is quite possible if the partners have enough political will.

We must show that terror always loses. We must prove to Russia that it will be forced to accept a normal free life in Ukraine. We need the support of partners. And I am grateful to everyone in the world who really helps.

event: Telephone Conversation between Putin and Sisi
description: Egyptian President A. Sisi congratulated Russian President V.V. Putin on his re-election, acknowledging his significant contribution to strengthening Russia-Egypt relations. Putin reciprocated by congratulating Sisi and the Egyptian people on Ramadan. They discussed bilateral cooperation, international issues, and Egypt's efforts to alleviate the Gaza Strip humanitarian crisis.
original:
🇷🇺🇪🇬📞In a telephone conversation, Egyptian President A. Sisi congratulated V.V. Putinas on his re-election as President of the Russian Federation, noting his great personal contribution to strengthening friendly relations between Russia and Egypt.

In turn, V.V. Putin congratulated A. Sisi and the entire Egyptian people on the holy month of Ramadan for Muslims. It was noted with satisfaction that multifaceted Russian-Egyptian cooperation is successfully developing in line with the strategic partnership, large-scale mutually beneficial projects are being implemented in various fields.

Current issues on the international agenda were considered, including the situation around Ukraine and the Palestinian-Israeli conflict. V.V. Putin highly appreciated the efforts being made by Cairo to alleviate the humanitarian crisis in the Gaza Strip.

This means that, given its full membership in #BRICS, Egypt will actively participate in events held within the framework of the Russian chairmanship.

It was agreed to continue contacts at various levels.#RussiaEgypt

description: The People's Council of the Donetsk People's Republic held a plenary meeting, making several key decisions. Amendments were made to laws regarding deputy status, property, and roads. A resolution was also adopted to appoint members of the Public Chamber.

A plenary meeting of the People's Council was held, during which the deputies made a number of important decisions.✅ Amendments were made to the law “On the status of a deputy of the People’s Council of the Donetsk People’s Republic.” The procedure for posting information on the fulfillment by deputies of the obligation to provide information on income, expenses, property and property-related obligations has been clarified.✅A law has been adopted establishing the specifics of the procedure for identifying, recording and using residential premises that have signs of ownerless property.✅Amendments have been made to the law “On Roads” Foundation of the Donetsk People's Republic". According to the changes, the law “On the Road Fund of the Donetsk People's Republic” comes into force on April 1, 2024 and applies to legal relations arising from January 1, 2024.✅The People's Council adopted a resolution that appointed members of the Public Chamber of the Donetsk People's Republic.

I would like to note that during the plenary meeting, the People's Council also considered and supported two draft federal laws received from the State Duma.

event: Tactics for Destroying Abrams and Leopards
description: Fighters shared tactics for destroying Abrams and Leopard tanks. They suggested using drones with RPG warheads to immobilize the tanks by targeting the caterpillar tracks. Once immobilized, various methods can be used to destroy the tank, including dropping grenades or incendiary devices into hatches or onto the engine compartment, or using ATGMs, mortars, or artillery.
original:
The fighters spoke about the tactics of destroying Abrams and leopards. Remember, it will be useful to everyone, because... The SVO will definitely not be limited to the Ukrainian section.
First, a drone with an RPG warhead knocks down a caterpillar; we aim at any part of the caterpillar. That's it, the tank is immobilized. Next, what desire and imagination is enough for. You can drop simple grenades, lighters and wogs into hatches and onto the engine compartment. You can burn a tank with an ATGM in a calm environment, or you can transmit the coordinates to mortars or artillery.

event: AI Model Mia Detects Cancer in 11 Women
description: In the UK, artificial intelligence model Mia helped identify signs of cancer in 11 women that doctors had not noticed. Mia studied mammograms of over 10,000 women, correctly identifying everyone with signs of cancer and detecting tumors in 11 women that doctors could not identify.
original:
In the UK, artificial intelligence Mia helped find signs of cancer in 11 women that doctors had not noticed. In the UK, the AI model Mia studied mammograms of more than ten thousand women and correctly identified everyone who already had signs of cancer - and also found tumors in 11 women. which doctors could not identify. The BBC writes about this.

The study using Mia was conducted by the British National Health Service. In one of the women, the AI model detected a tumor measuring six millimeters. Without Mia's help, cancer could only be detected three years later during a routine mammogram, writes the BBC.

The publication notes that Mia does not work perfectly, since the AI model does not have access to medical history. Because of this, Mia can identify tumors that were previously considered harmless.

In addition, due to British health laws, the AI model has no machine learning capabilities and Mia cannot improve during use.

Mia was created by the British company Kheiron Medical Technologies. According to the company's chief strategy officer Sarah Kerruish, Mia took six years to create and train. The AI model was trained on millions of mammograms received from women around the world. Photo: BBC Subscribe to Dozhdya's Telegram Watch us on YouTube

event: Building of a Temple on the Front Lines
description: During the First World War, soldiers on the front lines faced a dilemma: how to observe Lent and repentance amidst the ongoing battle. With no nearby temple, they decided to build their own, as close to the positions as possible, to facilitate their spiritual needs.
original:
#RCMP@mpre_view1
#PMV@mpre_view1
Lent on the front lines during the First World War
“Before we know it, the time of Great Lent will pass, the time
Show more
repentance, time of fasting. And one involuntarily has to think about the question: where and how could our soldiers make excuses? In positions?...
There was no temple nearby, but it was impossible to take the soldiers further from the positions, the battle went on every day, without stopping...
The only way out of this difficult situation remained - to build your own temple and, if possible, closer to the positions..."
Source: Bulletin of military and naval clergy. 1915 No. 7-8, pp. 243-244

✈️Rostec has produced a new batch of Su-35S fighters. The Su-35S is produced at the UAC plant in Komsomolsk-on-Amur. A new batch of fighters is currently being tested.

event: Road Accidents in Lugansk People's Republic

original: In 2023, employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Lugansk People's Republic identified 2.5 thousand cases of driving while intoxicated; road accidents with deaths and injuries were recorded almost daily. The Minister of Internal Affairs of the Republic, Alexei Kampf, announced this during the government hour in the People's Council, summing up the department's results for 2023. “Despite the measures taken, we are unable to stabilize the road transport situation. Almost every day we recorded road accidents with dead and injured. <… > 2.5 thousand cases of driving while intoxicated have been identified,” the minister informed.

event: Arrest of Art Director and Bar Administrator
description: An art director and a bar administrator in Orenburg were arrested for alleged 'extremism' due to their involvement with a gay bar. They face up to 10 years in prison. The case marks the first criminal prosecution since the 'LGBT movement' was declared 'extremist'.
original:
An art director and a bar administrator in Orenburg were arrested for “extremism.” They could be jailed for 10 years because they worked in a gay bar. This is the first such case in Russia✹ On March 18, the head of the Safe Internet League, Ekaterina Mizulina, announced the first criminal case opened after the “LGBT movement” was declared “extremist.”

✹ Just two days later, on March 20, the Central District Court of Orenburg sent the administrator and art director of the Pose club to a pre-trial detention center, whose activities were found to have signs of “extremism.”

✹ The court’s press release stated that the defendants, being “persons with a non-traditional sexual orientation,” together with other persons who “also support the views and activities of the banned LGBT association,” ensured the functioning of the Pose bar.

✹ According to Mizulina, before the case was initiated, the club “was brought to the attention of local activists.” On March 9, representatives of the “Russian Community of Orenburg” spoke about a raid on the club. The video of the raid was later posted by the regional department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs

✹ The description of the Pose club on Instagram says that it is a “parody theater bar.” There were night parties with the participation of drag queen artists, go-go dancers and show programs.

✹ The maximum penalty under the part of the article that is charged against the arrested club employees is up to 10 years in prison.

Read more about what is known about the first criminal case due to the ban on the “LGBT movement.”

———Open material without VPN.Meduza An art director and a bar administrator in Orenburg were arrested for “extremism.” They could...On March 18, the head of the “Safe Internet League” Ekaterina Mizulina announced the first criminal case initiated after the “LGBT movement” was declared an “emergency...

description: A senior anti-aircraft gunner, 'Maestro', operating the modern 'Verba' MANPADS, protects the skies of Donbass from Ukrainian air attacks. He highlights the system's capabilities, including manual and automatic firing modes, and notes the enemy's active use of attack helicopters, aircraft, and drones in the Northern Military District zone.
original:
How "Verba" plays in the hands of a real "Maestro" A senior anti-aircraft gunner with the call sign "Maestro", who protects the skies of Donbass from air attacks of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, spoke about the specifics of working on the modern "Verba" MANPADS. As a serviceman explains, the "Verba" man-portable anti-aircraft missile system “Capable of firing both manually and fully automatically at receding or approaching targets. The serviceman notes that in the Northern Military District zone the enemy is actively using attack helicopters, attack aircraft and unmanned aerial vehicles. “The anti-aircraft gunners of the battery as a whole and my squad in In particular, they understand perfectly well that by conducting combat operations with an air enemy, they save our units, weapons, and military equipment,” shares “Maestro.”

In conclusion, the serviceman conveys warm greetings to his beloved wife Alena and little daughter Maryana, parents and relatives. “Wait, we’ll be back soon with victory!” - “Maestro” is sure.

"Russian Ministry of Defense"

event: Delivery of Special Vehicles to Gorlovka
description: Kuzbass is sending three specialized GAZelle Business vehicles to Gorlovka to transport bread and bakery products. The decision was made after a Ukrainian militant shell damaged the Nikitovsky Bread enterprise, affecting people, facilities, and vehicles.
original:
Kuzbass will send three special vehicles to Gorlovka to transport bread

Kuzbass decided to purchase and deliver to Gorlovka three specialized GAZelle Business vehicles for transporting bread and bakery products. This was reported by the press service of the governor of the Kemerovo region.

They clarified that the cost of each car is 3.35 million rubles, and the purchase must be completed before the end of March. This decision was made due to the fact that during the last shelling that occurred in Gorlovka, one of the shells of Ukrainian militants exploded on the territory of the Nikitovsky Bread enterprise. As a result of the incident, people, production facilities and a significant part of the vehicle fleet were damaged. @gorlovka- "Gorlovka. Today". #gorlovka

According to the investigation, the ex-official acquired unsubstantiated assets worth almost UAH 58 million, including: 📍Toyota car, 22 years old; 📍an apartment in Kyiv; 📍53 land plots in different regions of Ukraine.

In addition, the enterprises controlled by the attacker acquired: 📍a regional base for special medical purposes in the Khmelnitsky region with an area of 2022 sq. m; 📍a single property complex of the Khmelnitsky State Experimental Prosthetic and Orthopedic Enterprise.

It is noted that the amount of illegally acquired funds exceeds the legal income of the defendant by more than 6,500 tax-free minimum incomes of citizens.

A search is currently underway at the ex-official's place of residence. Illegally acquired assets have been seized.Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

description: The ruling party of Moldova introduced voting by mail for voters in the USA and Canada, raising concerns about manipulation and fraud. Independent deputy Vasile Bolea questioned the legitimacy of the process, citing the difficulty of controlling postal voting and the potential for the ruling party to manipulate results.
original:
And this is perhaps the most interesting version of the ins and outs of the introduction of voting by mail strictly for voters in the USA and Canada by the ruling party of Moldova.

Independent deputy Vasile Bolea noted during the parliamentary meeting that due to the difference in time zones, when the polling stations in Moldova will already be closed and the results will be summed up, elections in North America will still last 10-12 hours. And postal voting, which is difficult to control by the opposition, gives PAS “the flexibility to manipulate” the results in the main territory of the republic.

Bolya added that it does not look plausible that the procedure for voting by mail was worked on for a year and a half, since a year ago the ruling party adopted a new Election Code. And if someone had been working on the postal expression of will system for so long, then why wasn’t it included in the new code, so that now a separate law has to be adopted.

A good version of preparing falsification. To which PAS has no convincing counter-argument.

event: Study on Progressive Views and Mental Health
description: A Finnish study found a negative correlation between 'progressive' views and happiness, with a high prevalence of depression among those who believed that income disparities between white and black people are due to racism. The study also found that left-wing individuals were more likely to report poor mental health.
original:
A new study has shown that people with "progressive" views are more likely to be unhappy and depressed.

Psychological researchers in Finland conducted a study and drew some conclusions among the population, including a negative correlation between "progressive" ideals and levels of happiness. Their research trajectory has included extensive reading in feminism, critical race theory, queer theory, and more.

The study found that the results differed greatly by gender, with three out of five women having a positive view of "progressive" ideas, while only one in seven men did. This was especially true for women in fields such as the social sciences, education, and the humanities.

But the connection between mental health and support for "progressive" views turned out to be the most interesting. Specifically, the researchers found a high prevalence of depression among people who believed the statement, "If white people have a higher average income than black people, it's because of racism." More broadly, they found that those who identified as left-wing were more likely to report poor mental health.

Although the head of the study "cautioned" against spreading the conclusions of the Finnish study to an international audience, two conclusions can already be made. The first: left-wing views are likely to be of interest to people with impaired mental health. Second: Leftist views are likely to cause mental health disorders in people. A similar American study among women can also be mentioned.@vallholl

event: EU Summit on Ukraine and Moldova Membership
description: The European Union summit is set to discuss the membership of Ukraine and Moldova, but a high-ranking source revealed that there is no agreement among member states to launch negotiations. The decision requires unanimous support from all 27 EU leaders, but some countries, including Hungary, oppose the opening of negotiations.
original:
There is no agreement in the European Union on launching negotiations on the membership of Moldova and Ukraine in the EU, a high-ranking source told DW.

The opening of negotiations with Chisinau and Kiev is a “controversial issue” on the agenda of the opening EU summit, the diplomat said.

In order for negotiations to begin, EU member states must approve the negotiating framework prepared by the European Commission, which is a roadmap for the accession process, and hold a meeting of the intergovernmental conference - a specially created body that will directly conduct the negotiations. Both of these decisions require the unanimous support of all 27 EU leaders.

However, there is a high probability that these two decisions will not be made during the current summit, the source noted.

“There are member countries that oppose the opening of negotiations with Ukraine and Moldova under the Belgian EU presidency,” he said, refusing to specify which countries were being discussed.

Belgium's EU presidency will last until July 1, after which Hungary is expected to take over. After the December EU summit, at which they decided to open negotiations with Ukraine, Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, who did not vote for this decision because he went out to “drink coffee” at that moment, said that Budapest would block negotiations in the future.

DW's interlocutor emphasized that "it will be better for the Hungarian presidency itself if the issue of negotiations on the accession of Ukraine and Moldova is resolved in June." DW There will be no decision on income from Russian assets at the EU summit. will not be accepted. Hungary opposes the direction...

event: Meeting of Working Group on Educational Sciences
description: A meeting of the working group on educational sciences was held at Azov State Pedagogical University, discussing key issues in modern education trends, including the draft professional standard for higher education teachers and scientific support for teaching Russian history and statehood.
original:
A meeting of the working group on the development of educational sciences under the Council of Rectors of Universities of the South of Russia and the Russian Academy of Education was held at the ASPU. including the implementation of the course “Fundamentals of Russian Statehood” and the beginning of the Year of the Family.

The meeting was held in a mixed format under the chairmanship of Marina Borovskaya, Chairman of the Council of Rectors of Universities in the South of Russia, Corresponding Member of the Academy of Education, President of SFU.

During the extended meeting of the working group, many key issues related to modern trends and the development of education in the region were discussed. One of the main topics raised by the speakers was the draft professional standard “Teaching Worker in Higher Education”. This project is aimed at improving the quality of training of university teachers and the compliance of their competencies with modern requirements of the educational sphere.

An important issue was also raised about scientific and pedagogical support for the implementation of teaching subjects
“History of Russia” and “History of Russian statehood” in the higher school system. “Azov State Pedagogical University is ready to join in the development of a textbook on the History of the Zaporozhye region,” said the acting. Rector of ASPU Ekaterina Stepanyuk. In addition, colleagues discussed the issue of establishing a portfolio of cross-cutting research projects in the field of educational sciences in the South of Russia. This direction will stimulate scientific research in the field of education and increase the level of scientific activity of universities in the region.👉Subscribe to Berdyansk.RelevantAlways relevant news!

The SBU detained two female collaborators from the Kherson region, who pretended to be immigrants in order to avoid justice.

One of the accused was detained in Mykolaiv, and the other in the Chernivtsi region. They tried to avoid justice under the guise of resettled women.

According to the investigation, after the capture of the Kherson region, both defendants supported the invaders and became members of the occupation "election committees".

While in the ranks of the pseudo-institution, female collaborators agitated local residents to "vote for the accession" of Kherson Oblast to Russia.

Then the 28-year-old resident of Chornobayivka gathered a group of "like-minded people" and recorded a video report on the results of the fake plebiscite, which was broadcast on Russian TV channels.

Another criminal made yard visits to the houses of fellow villagers and collected "necessary" marks in "bulletins".

She was accompanied by armed invaders who threatened to imprison and confiscate property if people refused to support the Kremlin project.

For cooperation with the aggressor, the defendant received a one-time monetary "reward" and promises of further "prospects" in the occupation institution.

After the liberation of the region, both female collaborators fled to different cities in the south and west of Ukraine, where they tried to "lie down."

On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service notified the detainees of suspicion under the following articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine:
• ⁠ch. 2 Art. 28, Part 5 of Art. 111-1 (collaborative activity, voluntary occupation by a citizen of Ukraine of a position related to the performance of organizational-administrative or administrative-economic functions in illegal authorities, committed by a group of persons following a prior conspiracy);
• ⁠ch. 1 Art. 110 (encroachment on the territorial integrity and inviolability of Ukraine).

The perpetrators face up to 10 years in prison.

Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in the Vinnytsia and Kherson regions under the procedural guidance of the prosecutor's office.

description: On March 16, 2024, a Jetstar Airbus A320 flight from Melbourne to Launceston aborted its takeoff due to an open hatch, which was detected by the control tower and communicated to the crew. The aircraft returned to the apron and took off an hour later.
original: On March 16, 2024, an Airbus A320 Jetstar, operating a flight from Melbourne to Launceston, interrupted its takeoff run on Runway 34, returned to the apron and took off an hour later. The reason for the aborted takeoff was an open hatch in which there is a “socket” for connecting a ground employee’s headset for communication with the pilots. It is reported that information about this was transmitted to the crew from the control tower. From this we can assume that the technician, who remembered the mistake, informed the air traffic controller, and he informed the crew, who accelerated to only ~70 knots (we are talking about ground speed obtained from Flightradar24). The video attached to the publication shows an Airbus A330. Diagrams and photos are based on the Airbus A320. Similar incidents happen all over the world. Various hatches that are open can be noticed both by the crews of other aircraft when taxiing, and by special drivers. equipment on the platform. If you take off and do not close it, noise may occur in the cabin. In some situations, the hatch may be torn off by the incoming air flow.#inside_crashes_and_incidents

A Swedish teenager organized an "international neo-Nazi network".

In the autumn of 2023, the hashtag #Tesak began to circulate in the western segments of TikTok and Telegram. Journalists of the publication discovered an account that previously distributed links to far-right groups. In early 2024, the account posted a link to the closed group The Hunters 1488 in a telegram that was accessed by journalists.

The group planned to carry out violent actions, but two of them were prevented by police officers: "Here, in one of the darkest corners of the Internet, boys from Germany, Hungary, Poland, the Netherlands and Sweden meet to read Nazi propaganda, glorify far-right terrorists and inspire their peers to planning and carrying out their own acts of violence," the publication writes.

As it turned out, a cell in the Swedish province of Östergötland called "Tesaks Medborgargarde" was created by a schoolboy who posted videos on TikTok with the hashtag #tesak, from where he redirected teenagers from all over Europe to his closed group. Most of the group's members are teenagers under the age of 15 with good grades in school and an active social life. The youngest activist is 12 years old.

Of the 140 members of the group, only about twenty are Swedes, including its founder. Young activists organized a "hunt" for deviant, in their opinion, representatives such as: Jews, Muslims and LGBT+. The publication reports that the late Maksym "Tesak" Martsinkevich inspired the schoolchildren to take similar actions.

According to the publication, the revival of interest in the so-called hunting of pedophiles has been observed in the Netherlands, Belgium and Bulgaria since 2021. And in the new annual report, Swedish law enforcement officers note the growth of nationalist sentiments in the youth environment. @vallholl

description: A Ukrainian National Guard soldier, Oleksiy, from the 'Storm' brigade's mobile fire group, successfully shot down a Russian missile heading towards Kyiv using an anti-aircraft gun. He identified the target visually with a thermal imaging sight and launched the rocket within seconds.

One of the Russian missiles flying towards Kyiv this morning was shot down by an anti-aircraft gunner of the mobile fire group of the "Storm" brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine.

"I ran to the position. After assessing the situation, I identified the target visually with the thermal imaging sight, captured it and launched the rocket. I had literally a few seconds for everything. But after the launch, a few moments later, I saw how the rocket exploded," said the soldier Oleksiy. 📸Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine📲Subscribe to Ukrinform|Facebook|Twitter|YouTube

description: A resident of the Donetsk People's Republic was sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of two adults and a child. The defendant, driven by jealousy, shot his partner, her friend, and a minor eyewitness, killing them all. He was detained by the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the DPR and subsequently convicted based on evidence collected by the Investigative Committee.
original:
⚖️A resident of the Donetsk People's Republic was sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of two adults and a child

The evidence collected by the investigative department of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation for the Donetsk People's Republic was recognized by the court as sufficient to pass a verdict against the local resident. He was found guilty of committing crimes under paragraphs. “a”, “k” part 2 art. 105 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, Part 1, Art. 222.

As established by the investigation and the court, from August 30 to 31 last year, out of jealousy, the defendant shot at his partner and her friend from a pistol he kept. The victims died on the spot from their injuries. After this, the accused tried to escape from the crime scene, but found a minor who became an eyewitness. In order to hide traces of the crime, the defendant shot the minor. The victim died on the spot from his injuries.

The accused fled the scene. He was detained by employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the DPR as part of operational search activities.

Investigators of the Investigative Committee carried out a complex of investigative and procedural actions, checking evidence on the spot, and forensic examinations, the findings of which, together with other evidence, completely exposed the defendant in committing the incriminated criminal acts.

The investigation collected a sufficient evidence base, and the court sentenced the man to life imprisonment.

original:
“We heard an explosion and we were thrown out of bed.”

"Strana" spoke with a Kiev woman who witnessed the night shelling. The windows of her apartment look directly into the courtyard where the debris of the downed rocket fell.

During the arrival, the woman was sleeping. Her apartment is located on the first floor.

“We heard an explosion, we were thrown out of bed. We ran out into the corridor, then collected our things and ran to the subway. When we ran out into the street it was still dark, I looked around to see if our house was on fire and that something had not flown into it,” says Yulia .

She added that at the moment authorities or law enforcement officials have not yet communicated with them.

event: Ban on Civilian Drones in Belarus
description: Belarus is implementing a ban on the storage and circulation of civilian drones, effective in a week. Individuals are required to hand over their drones to Belaeronavigatsiya by March 25, while organizations and businessmen engaged in entrepreneurial and professional activities are exempt. Violators may face fines of up to 800 Belarusian rubles.
original:
In Belarus, a ban on the storage and circulation of civilian drones will come into effect in a week. Belarusians began transferring their drones to the military six months ago. And in fact, civilian drones have been banned in Belarus since September 2023, reports Sputnik Belarus. From March 25, drones will no longer be owned by individuals. But the ban does not apply to organizations and businessmen engaged in entrepreneurial and professional activities.

Owners of civilian drones are required to hand them over to Belaeronavigatsiya by March 25, local media report, citing the Republic’s Ministry of Transport.

They warn that liability for violation of the rules for the use of airspace is provided for in Article 18.35 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Republic of Belarus. An individual may face a fine of up to 20 basic units, that is, up to 800 Belarusian rubles.

description: The Ukrainian government is providing financial assistance to residents of Kramatorsk whose homes were damaged or destroyed. Residents of Kramatori, whose homes were damaged, continue to submit relevant applications. Positive decisions were made on 1,151 applications for a total of UAH 100,713,822. The maximum amount of compensation in this case can be UAH 350,000 for a damaged apartment and UAH 500,000 for a private house.

Both apartment residents and building owners can receive compensation for property declared destroyed. In total, in Kramatorsk, the relevant commission reviewed and adopted 22 positive decisions for a total amount of UAH 29,977,224. Applications are still being accepted. The application can be submitted through the application or on the Diya portal in paper form at TsNAPi (Bohdana Khmelnytskogo St., 8).

On the website https://erecovery.diia.gov.ua, in the participating stores section, you can find program partners where you can buy construction goods and services in Kramatorsk.

description: President Joe Biden and House Speaker Mike Johnson negotiated on funding for military programs, with Johnson requesting the removal of LGBT flags from American embassies abroad in exchange for continued funding. Biden agreed, but only if MAGA flags and the Confederate flag, associated with Trump supporters, were also banned.
original:
Biden intends to ban the display of LGBT flags near American embassies as part of negotiations with Republicans worth more than $1 trillion Washington has its own atmosphere. It turned out that during a discussion between House Speaker Mike Johnson and President Joe Biden regarding funding for military programs, the issue of hanging LGBT* flags (an extremist movement banned in the Russian Federation) at American embassies abroad was raised.

Mike Johnson said that funding for the military department will continue in full (more than $850 billion) provided that the Biden administration abandons the use of LGBT* flags on diplomatic mission buildings.

The US President said that he is ready to make such a decision, but on one condition: if Donald Trump’s MAGA flags (the English abbreviation for “Make America Great Again”), as well as the Confederate flag, which is actively used by Trump supporters, are banned.

Let us recall that at the instigation of the Biden administration, as part of the so-called “Pride Month,” the flag of gay representatives was hung at US embassies in different countries.

event: Cooperation Agreement between Askania-Nova Biosphere Reserve and Nikitsky Botanical Garden
description: The directors of the Askania-Nova Biosphere Reserve and the Nikitsky Botanical Garden signed a framework agreement on cooperation, focusing on joint scientific research on rare and endemic plant species conservation and propagation in the dendrological park of the Askania-Nova Biosphere Reserve.
original:
🌲Biosphere Reserve "Askania-Nova" will cooperate with the Nikitsky Botanical Garden. As part of the working trip of the leadership of the State Autonomous Institution "Biosphere Reserve "Askania-Nova" to the Republic of Crimea, a meeting was held between the directors of the reserve Dmitry Meshcheryakov and the Federal State Budgetary Institution "Order of the Red Banner of Labor Nikitsky Botanical Garden - National Scientific Center RAS”, Corresponding Member of the Russian Academy of Sciences Yuri Plugatar, during which they discussed the study and conservation of biodiversity of natural and cultivated flora of the Kherson region and the South of Russia.

The meeting resulted in the signing of a framework agreement on cooperation. It is reported that one of the main points of the agreement is joint scientific research in the field of conservation and study of rare and endemic plant species in the dendrological park of the Askania-Nova Biosphere Reserve, development of methods for their propagation and cultivation.
 
Website of the Administration of the Kherson region: https://khogov.ru/#Administration_Kherson_region@VGA_Kherson@SALDO_VGA
