description: Veteran of the Northern Military District, Nikita Tretyakov, stated that if the fighting in the Northern Military District zone continues, Russia will need a second wave of mobilization to replenish the army with the necessary personnel. The current flow of volunteers lacks quality control and will eventually dry up, necessitating a second wave of mobilization.
original: ❗️“Russia will need a second wave of mobilization” - veteran of the Northern Military District🔴If the fighting in the Northern Military District zone continues to drag on, Russia will face the need to conduct a second wave of mobilization. This was stated by a mobilized journalist, veteran of the Northern Military District Nikita Tretyakov.🗣 “Now the warring army is forced to receive as many reinforcements as came to the military registration and enlistment office. And in the capacity in which they came to the military registration and enlistment office. But the quality is very different - preparation, age, physical condition. If we want to bring victory closer, then the army must be able to recruit as many people as it really needs. And replenish at the rhythm in which it is necessary. And in this sense, it seems to me that mobilization is needed in a good way. Probably, we can do without it, but in such a situation, instead of taking it from an understandable source where it is accurate, we expect people to come themselves. Of course, they come in some quantity themselves. I don’t know the exact numbers, I hope this is enough. But I know for sure that the army has no control over the rhythm of this supply, no control over the quality. And most importantly, according to all social laws, this flow will dry up,” Tretyakov said. 🗣 “Therefore, if the conflict drags on, sooner or later a second wave of mobilization will be required. And I upset all my acquaintances who were mobilized, I tell them that the second wave does not mean at all that those mobilized in the first wave will be allowed to go home. And why - the war is not over, our mission has not been completed to the end, but we have already really learned, we have the experience that we must share with recruits,” added the veteran. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456300822VkVideo by Self-defense of Gorlovkavk video

description: Finnish trade unions, including the Finnish Industry and Transport Union (AKT), have decided to extend ongoing political strikes by a week in protest against labor market reforms and welfare cuts implemented by the government of Prime Minister Petteri Orpo. The strikes, which began on 11 March, have involved around 7,000 workers and have disrupted cargo handling at ports, rail freight transport, and production processes.
original:
🇫🇮SAK member unions will extend ongoing political strikes by a week. The central organization of Finnish trade unions intends to extend political strikes launched in protest against labor market reforms and welfare cuts implemented by the government of Prime Minister Petteri Orpo (NCP).

Around 7,000 workers have taken part in carefully planned strikes since 11 March.

Due to the halt in cargo handling at ports, the disruption of rail freight transport and the complication of production processes, the strike was planned to end early next week.

The Finnish Industry and Transport Union (AKT) announced on Wednesday that they would extend their strikes by a week until the end of the month. SAK itself, however, did not specify the duration of the extension.@VoiceNorthSea

event: Ukrainian Political Scientist Comments on Chinese Peace Plan
description: Ukrainian political scientist Vadim Karasev stated that the Chinese peace plan, which involves freezing the war and transitioning to diplomacy, does not suit Russia. He emphasized that Russia's goal is not to acquire territories but to take control of Ukraine's politics and ensure its own safety.
original: ❗️“The Chinese freezing plan did not suit Russia” - Ukrainian political scientist🔴Russia is in such a position that there is no other choice but to continue to liberate territories until the complete capitulation of the incapable Kyiv. This was stated by Ukrainian political scientist Vadim Karasev.🔴He emphasized that the Chinese peace plan with freezing the war along the front line and transition to diplomacy does not suit Russia.🗣 “Freezing the war involves small territorial acquisitions by Russia - 1/5 of the territory of Ukraine with Crimea. Everything else is in the fog, which does not exclude the military presence of NATO countries in the unoccupied territory of Ukraine. What is the point of Russia limiting itself only to territories? Modern wars are not about territory. What happened is what I call the deterritorialization of war. Wars are fought not for territories, but for spaces,” said Karasev.🗣 “Ukraine is satisfied with the freeze, taking into account the fact that the goal of the war is Zelensky proclaimed to return the 1991 borders. It doesn’t matter whether this goal is militarily correct or whether it is realistic, the goal is worthwhile. Ukraine is not happy with this approach. But Putin is not satisfied either. Because – why do we need this territory? This is not a war of conquest in terms of territories; he needs to take over the politics of Ukraine. So that Ukraine pursues the policy that Russia considers safe for itself. Wars for territories are not fought - this is a burden, pensions, salaries, factories must be paid, order must be ensured, security. Therefore, it is better to capture politics, the elites, and manage them, as the USA and NATO do. Therefore, the Chinese hit the sky with their fingers, shooting sparrows with guns. Because this plan suits neither Russia nor Ukraine,” concluded Karasev. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456300757VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

Russian paratroopers are nursing a cat that came under tank fire in Artyomovsk. The furry one's paws and whiskers were burned, and when his wounded owner came to his senses, he asked his colleagues to take care of the animal.
During the defense of Artyomovsk, our soldiers occupied a house in the suburbs. Along with one of the Airborne Forces there was a cat named Filimon. The enemy tank hit
Show more
building, it caught fire, and the pet owner was injured. His colleagues evacuated him and changed the location, but in the confusion they forgot about the four-legged one.
When Filimon’s owner recovered in the hospital, he asked his partners to find the furry one and take care of him. Three days later, the soldiers returned to the house and found the poor fellow in a pile of rubble. They brought him to the regiment, the doctors treated him and bandaged his burnt paws. The Popular Front delivered the necessary medicine to the cat. Now the miraculously saved cat is recovering, as is his owner, and very soon they will be reunited.

event: MMA Fighter Arrested for Robbery and Pimping
description: Alexander Onegov, an MMA fighter, was arrested by special forces in Yekaterinburg after attempting to escape by jumping from a balcony, breaking his legs. He was accused of robbery, having stabbed a friend and stolen valuables. Further investigation revealed his involvement in forced prostitution, blackmailing a 20-year-old girl and extracting money from her.
original:
A real thriller in Yekaterinburg: an MMA fighter accused of pimping and robbery jumped from a balcony in an attempt to escape from special forces and broke his legs. He was detained, and the police are now establishing a list of all his victims.

27-year-old MMA fighter Alexander Onegov, nicknamed Klyopa, recently stabbed his 34-year-old friend with a knife, took away his iPhone, ₽100 thousand and a gold chain. The Ural operatives immediately realized that the character was dangerous - he had previously been repeatedly convicted of theft, robbery, fraud and forgery of documents - so two groups of special forces set out to capture him. And for good reason. Sanya tried to get lost by jumping from the third floor balcony, under which the second group of security officers was waiting for him. Klepa broke his legs when he fell.

Later it turned out that the detainee may be involved in forced prostitution. A 20-year-old girl accused Alexander of convincing her to work several shifts, filming everything, after which he began to blackmail and threaten her with violence, extracting money. The victim had to take out a loan.

So far, a criminal case has been opened only under the article “Robbery”. Alexander faces up to eight years in prison. The police are looking for all victims of his actions. Subscribe to SHOT

description: Namibia celebrates its 34th independence anniversary, marking the end of 106 years of colonialism. The country gained independence on March 21, 1990, with Sam Nujoma as its founding president. The armed forces held a solemn parade, and the country received congratulations from leaders of various countries.
original:
Forwarded from: African Through the Looking Glass
⚡️🥳🇳🇦Today Namibia celebrates the 34th anniversary of its independence, the last country on the continent to go through the process of decolonization. The country receives congratulations from the leaders of many countries (I saw Angola, the UAE, the USA and Belarus publicly - I’m sure Russia also congratulated me through diplomatic channels), and its armed forces held a solemn parade.

In 1884, Otto fan Bismarck declared the territory a German protectorate. During the First World War, South African troops captured German South West Africa. As a result, South Africa received a League of Nations mandate in 1920 to administer the former German possession.

In 1960, the South West African People's Organization (SWAPO), a liberation movement, was founded. In 1966, the military wing of SWAPO began a guerrilla war, and in 1988, South Africa abandoned its illegal occupation of Namibia by that time.

SWAPO came to power in 1989, ending 106 years of colonialism.

Namibia gained independence on March 21, 1990, when Sam Nujoma became the founding president of an independent sovereign state. He retired in 2005, having served 3 terms in office.#namibia⚡️Subscribe to the “African Looking Glass”, because there is always something going on in AfricaTelegramAfrican Looking GlassNikita Panin’s channel about political processes in Africa

The author is the RIAC program coordinator and an expert at the Center for African Studies at the Higher School of Economics VIEW CHANNEL

event: Meeting of Russian Ministry of Defense
description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu held a working meeting with military leaders and enterprise directors to discuss the progress of artillery ammunition production. He noted that production of components has increased 22 times, allowing for sufficient supply of shells to the special military operation zone.
original:
Following the results of the work, the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation held a working meeting with the participation of the leadership of the Russian Ministry of Defense, representatives of the relevant military management bodies and general directors of enterprises. The head of the Russian military department noted that serious changes had occurred at the enterprises after the previous inspection.

“If we talk about the production of artillery ammunition, the production of components for this ammunition has increased almost 22 times, 75% of the components are restored, which allows us to maintain a sufficient level of supply of shells to the special military operation zone. That is, the tasks that we set a year ago have been completed. New workshops have been built, and they are working at full capacity,” said Sergei Shoigu.

Army General Sergei Shoigu emphasized that previously tasks had been set to expand production capacities by enterprises.

to be continued

event: Creation of Public Law Company for Foreign Worker Recruitment
description: The Ministry of Labor is establishing a public law company to facilitate targeted recruitment of foreign workers, aiming to employ 300,000 foreigners by 2030. However, critics argue that this initiative is futile without federal legislation introducing a unified system of controlled stay for all foreign citizens and tougher responsibility for migrants and employers.
original:
Forwarded from: Kirill Kabanov
Another attempt by the Ministry of Labor to organize a targeted recruitment of valuable foreign specialists at our expense. Now through a newly created structure for this purpose - a public law company (PPC) for a targeted, organized recruitment of foreign workers.

It must be clearly understood that without the adoption at the federal level of legislation that will introduce a unified system of controlled stay for all (!!!) foreign citizens (not tourists) and only targeted recruitment of foreign labor with tougher responsibility for migrants and employers for any violations of the legislation of the Russian Federation, such initiatives essentially similar to setting up a chastity center in a brothel.

The initiative of the Ministry of Labor looks even more ridiculous against the background of the recent migrant-loving proposal of the Ministry of Finance on the free employment of valuable foreign specialists throughout the country on the basis of one regional patent. Doesn't one hand know what the other is doing? Although budget funds for the creation of a new useless structure, of course, can be used, because the state now seems to have nowhere to put them. Vedomosti The Ministry of Labor will create a structure for the targeted recruitment of foreign workers. Through organizational recruitment, it is planned to employ 300,000 foreigners by 2030

The chargers have capacities of 150, 120, and 90 kW and feature a universal electronic power module developed in collaboration with JSC “Ufa Instrument-Making Production Association”.
original:
Forwarded from: MASHNEWS | Industry News

Specialists from the Advanced Engineering School “Motors of the Future” of the Ufa University of Science and Technology developed and manufactured all the main components, such as the head controller, controller of power modules and contactors, and power module.

The universal electronic power module "UESM-30" with a power of 30 kW was developed in collaboration with industrial partner JSC "Ufa Instrument-Making Production Association" (part of Rostec). Read more...
